en.latex: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=a.2^{x+p} + q:\) with \(a=2\) through \((2;1)\) and with horizontal asymptote \(y=-1\)
en.html: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=a.2^{x+p} + q:\) with \(a=2\) through \((2;1)\) and with horizontal asymptote \(y=-1\)

en.latex: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q:\) with \(p=1\) through \((1;7)\) and with horizontal asymptote \(y=-5\)
en.html: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q:\) with \(p=1\) through \((1;7)\) and with horizontal asymptote \(y=-5\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{align}
y&=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q \\
y&=3\cdot b^{x+1}+q \\
y&=3\cdot b^{x+1}-5 \\
7&=3\cdot b^{1+1}-5 \\
7+5&=3\cdot b^2 \\
\frac{12}{3} &=b^2 \\
\therefore b^2&=4 \\
b=\pm{\sqrt{4}}&=\pm{2} \\
\text{But } b&>0 \\
\therefore b&=2 \\
\therefore y&=3\cdot2^{x+1}-5
\end{align}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{align}
y&=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q \\
y&=3\cdot b^{x+1}+q \\
y&=3\cdot b^{x+1}-5 \\
7&=3\cdot b^{1+1}-5 \\
7+5&=3\cdot b^2 \\
\frac{12}{3} &=b^2 \\
\therefore b^2&=4 \\
b=\pm{\sqrt{4}}&=\pm{2} \\
\text{But } b&>0 \\
\therefore b&=2 \\
\therefore y&=3\cdot2^{x+1}-5
\end{align}
$$

en.latex:
Draw the following functions on different Cartesian planes:
\(2y=2x^2-6x+4\)
en.html:
Draw the following functions on different Cartesian planes:
\(2y=2x^2-6x+4\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{align}
y&=\frac{2x^2}{2}-\frac{6x}{2}+\frac{4}{2} \\
y&=x^2-3x+2 \\
\text{Shape: } a>0; &\text{ Concave upwards} \\
y\text{-int: }&\rightarrow (0;2) \\
x\text{-int: }&\rightarrow x^2-3x+2=0 \\
(x-2)(x-1)&=0 \\
x=2 &\text{ or }x=1 \\
(2;0) &\text{ or } (1;0) \\
\text{Symm. axis: } x&=-\frac{b}{2a} \\
&=\frac{-(-3)}{2(1)}=\frac{3}{2} \\
\text{or }x&=\frac{x_1+x_2}{2} \\
&=\frac{2+1}{2}=\frac{3}{2} \\
\text{TP: }y&=\frac{3}{2}^2-3(\frac{3}{2})+2 \\
&=-\frac{1}{4} \\
\therefore TP&(\frac{3}{2};-\frac{1}{4})
\end{align}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{align}
y&=\frac{2x^2}{2}-\frac{6x}{2}+\frac{4}{2} \\
y&=x^2-3x+2 \\
\text{Shape: } a>0; &\text{ Concave upwards} \\
y\text{-int: }&\rightarrow (0;2) \\
x\text{-int: }&\rightarrow x^2-3x+2=0 \\
(x-2)(x-1)&=0 \\
x=2 &\text{ or }x=1 \\
(2;0) &\text{ or } (1;0) \\
\text{Symm. axis: } x&=-\frac{b}{2a} \\
&=\frac{-(-3)}{2(1)}=\frac{3}{2} \\
\text{or }x&=\frac{x_1+x_2}{2} \\
&=\frac{2+1}{2}=\frac{3}{2} \\
\text{TP: }y&=\frac{3}{2}^2-3(\frac{3}{2})+2 \\
&=-\frac{1}{4} \\
\therefore TP&(\frac{3}{2};-\frac{1}{4})
\end{align}
$$

en.latex:
Draw the following functions on different Cartesian planes:
\(y=-x^2-2x-3\)
en.html:
Draw the following functions on different Cartesian planes:
\(y=-x^2-2x-3\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{align}
\text{Shape: }a<0&\rightarrow \text{Concave downward} \\
y\text{-int: }(x=0)&\rightarrow (0;-3) \\
x\text{-int: }(y=0)&\rightarrow0=-x^2-2x-3 \\
&0=x^2+2x+3 \\
a=1 \ b&=2 \ c=3 \\
x&=\frac{-b\pm{\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}}{2a} \\
x&=\frac{-2\pm{\sqrt{2^2-4(1)(3)}}}{2(1)} \\
x&=\frac{-2\pm{\sqrt{-8}}}{2} \\
\text{No } \mathbb{R} &\text{ solutions} \\
\therefore \text{No } x&\text{-intercepts} \\
\text{Symm. axis: }x&=\frac{-b}{2a} \\
x&=\frac{-2}{2(1)} \\
x&=-1 \\
\text{TP: }y&=-(-1)^2-2(-1)-3 \\ 
y&=-2 \\
&\therefore TP(-1;-2) \\
\text{Check point: }&\text{Use symmetry} \\
&\rightarrow (-2;-3)
\end{align}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{align}
\text{Shape: }a<0&\rightarrow \text{Concave downward} \\
y\text{-int: }(x=0)&\rightarrow (0;-3) \\
x\text{-int: }(y=0)&\rightarrow0=-x^2-2x-3 \\
&0=x^2+2x+3 \\
a=1 \ b&=2 \ c=3 \\
x&=\frac{-b\pm{\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}}{2a} \\
x&=\frac{-2\pm{\sqrt{2^2-4(1)(3)}}}{2(1)} \\
x&=\frac{-2\pm{\sqrt{-8}}}{2} \\
\text{No } \mathbb{R} &\text{ solutions} \\
\therefore \text{No } x&\text{-intercepts} \\
\text{Symm. axis: }x&=\frac{-b}{2a} \\
x&=\frac{-2}{2(1)} \\
x&=-1 \\
\text{TP: }y&=-(-1)^2-2(-1)-3 \\ 
y&=-2 \\
&\therefore TP(-1;-2) \\
\text{Check point: }&\text{Use symmetry} \\
&\rightarrow (-2;-3)
\end{align}
$$

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
M\ \text{and}\ N\ \text{are the}\ &x-\text{intercepts of}\ f\ (\therefore y=0) \\
\therefore 0&=-x^2+2 x+8 \\
0&=x^2-2 x-8 \\
0&=(x-4)(x+2) \\
x=4\ &\text{or}\ x=-2 \\
N(4;0)&\ M(-2;0) \\
\therefore ON=4\ &\text{and}\ OM=2 \\
\therefore MN&=4+2=6
\end{aligned}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
M\ \text{and}\ N\ \text{are the}\ &x-\text{intercepts of}\ f\ (\therefore y=0) \\
\therefore 0&=-x^2+2 x+8 \\
0&=x^2-2 x-8 \\
0&=(x-4)(x+2) \\
x=4\ &\text{or}\ x=-2 \\
N(4;0)&\ M(-2;0) \\
\therefore ON=4\ &\text{and}\ OM=2 \\
\therefore MN&=4+2=6
\end{aligned}
$$

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
P\ \text{and}\ Q\ \text{are the}\ &y \text{-intercepts of} f\ \text{and}\ g \\
\therefore P(0;8)\ &\text{and}\ Q(0;-4) \\
\therefore OP=8\ &\text{and}\ OQ=4 \\
\therefore PQ&=8+4=12
\end{aligned}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
P\ \text{and}\ Q\ \text{are the}\ &y \text{-intercepts of} f\ \text{and}\ g \\
\therefore P(0;8)\ &\text{and}\ Q(0;-4) \\
\therefore OP=8\ &\text{and}\ OQ=4 \\
\therefore PQ&=8+4=12
\end{aligned}
$$

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
T\ \text{is the turning}&\text{ point of } T \\
\therefore \text{For symmetry axis:}&\ y=-x^2+2 x+8 \\
x=\frac{-b}{2a}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{x_1+x_2}{2} \\
=\frac{-2}{2(-1)}\ &\text{     }\ =\frac{4+(-2)}{2} \\
x=\frac{-2}{-2}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{2}{2}=1 \\
\therefore OK &=1 
\end{aligned}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
T\ \text{is the turning}&\text{ point of } T \\
\therefore \text{For symmetry axis:}&\ y=-x^2+2 x+8 \\
x=\frac{-b}{2a}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{x_1+x_2}{2} \\
=\frac{-2}{2(-1)}\ &\text{     }\ =\frac{4+(-2)}{2} \\
x=\frac{-2}{-2}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{2}{2}=1 \\
\therefore OK &=1 
\end{aligned}
$$

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
T\ \text{is the turning}&\text{ point of } T \\
\therefore \text{For symmetry axis:}&\ y=-x^2+2 x+8 \\
x=\frac{-b}{2a}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{x_1+x_2}{2} \\
=\frac{-2}{2(-1)}\ &\text{     }\ =\frac{4+(-2)}{2} \\
x=\frac{-2}{2}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{2}{2}=1 \\
\therefore OK &=1 \\
\text{And:}\ y=-(1)^2+2(1)+8&=-1+2+8=9 \\
\therefore TK&=9 \\
\text{For } KS: x=1 \text{ in } g(x)&=y=x-4 \\
\therefore y&=1-4=3 \\
\therefore KS&=3 \\
\therefore TS&=9+3=12
\end{aligned}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
T\ \text{is the turning}&\text{ point of } T \\
\therefore \text{For symmetry axis:}&\ y=-x^2+2 x+8 \\
x=\frac{-b}{2a}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{x_1+x_2}{2} \\
=\frac{-2}{2(-1)}\ &\text{     }\ =\frac{4+(-2)}{2} \\
x=\frac{-2}{2}\ &\text{or }x=\frac{2}{2}=1 \\
\therefore OK &=1 \\
\text{And:}\ y=-(1)^2+2(1)+8&=-1+2+8=9 \\
\therefore TK&=9 \\
\text{For } KS: x=1 \text{ in } g(x)&=y=x-4 \\
\therefore y&=1-4=3 \\
\therefore KS&=3 \\
\therefore TS&=9+3=12
\end{aligned}
$$

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
R \text{ and } N \text{ are the points of} &\text{ intersection of } f \text{ and } g \\
\therefore -x^2+2 x+8&=x-4 \\
0&=x-4+x^2-2 x-8 \\
0&=x^2-x-12 \\
0&=(x-4)(x+12) \\
x=4 &\rightarrow N(4;0) \\
\text{Or }x&=-3 \\
\therefore y&=x-4 \\
y&=-3-4 \\
y&=-7 \\
\therefore R&(-3;-7)
\end{aligned}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
R \text{ and } N \text{ are the points of} &\text{ intersection of } f \text{ and } g \\
\therefore -x^2+2 x+8&=x-4 \\
0&=x-4+x^2-2 x-8 \\
0&=x^2-x-12 \\
0&=(x-4)(x+12) \\
x=4 &\rightarrow N(4;0) \\
\text{Or }x&=-3 \\
\therefore y&=x-4 \\
y&=-3-4 \\
y&=-7 \\
\therefore R&(-3;-7)
\end{aligned}
$$

en.latex: Write down the coordinates of the turning point of \(f(x-2)\)
en.html: Write down the coordinates of the turning point of \(f(x-2)\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
f(x-2) \text{ moves } 2 &\text{ units to the right} \\
\therefore \text{if } f&\rightarrow TP(1;9) \\
\text{then } f(x-2) &\rightarrow TP(1+2;9) \\
\therefore TP(3;9)
\end{aligned}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
f(x-2) \text{ moves } 2 &\text{ units to the right} \\
\therefore \text{if } f&\rightarrow TP(1;9) \\
\text{then } f(x-2) &\rightarrow TP(1+2;9) \\
\therefore TP(3;9)
\end{aligned}
$$

en.latex: \(h(x)\) is the reflection of \(f(x)\) in the \(y\)-axis. Write down the equation of \(h\)
en.html: \(h(x)\) is the reflection of \(f(x)\) in the \(y\)-axis. Write down the equation of \(h\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Reflection in } y \text{-axis: }& f(x) \rightarrow f(-x) \\
\therefore h(x)=f(-x)&=-(-x)^2+2(-x)+8 \\
\therefore h(x)&=-x^2-2 x+8 \\
\end{aligned}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Reflection in } y \text{-axis: }& f(x) \rightarrow f(-x) \\
\therefore h(x)=f(-x)&=-(-x)^2+2(-x)+8 \\
\therefore h(x)&=-x^2-2 x+8 \\
\end{aligned}
$$

en.html:
Consider the following functions:

en.latex: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=a\cdot2^{x+p}+q:\) with \(y\)-intercept \(2\), a horizontal asymptote of \(6\) and \(a=-1\)
en.html: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=a\cdot2^{x+p}+q:\) with \(y\)-intercept \(2\), a horizontal asymptote of \(6\) and \(a=-1\)

en.latex: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q:\) with \(y\)-intercept at \(12\), a horizontal asymptote at \(0\) and \(b=\frac{1}{4}\)
en.html: Determine the equations of the exponential functions in the form \(y=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q:\) with \(y\)-intercept at \(12\), a horizontal asymptote at \(0\) and \(b=\frac{1}{4}\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{align}
y&=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q \\
y&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{x+p}+q \\
y&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{x+p}+0 \\
12&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{0+p} \\
\frac{12}{3}&=(4^{-1})^p \\
\therefore 4^{-p}&=4^1 \\
\therefore -p&=1 \\
p&=-1 \\
\therefore y&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{x-1}
\end{align}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{align}
y&=3\cdot b^{x+p}+q \\
y&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{x+p}+q \\
y&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{x+p}+0 \\
12&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{0+p} \\
\frac{12}{3}&=(4^{-1})^p \\
\therefore 4^{-p}&=4^1 \\
\therefore -p&=1 \\
p&=-1 \\
\therefore y&=3\cdot\frac{1}{4}^{x-1}
\end{align}
$$

en.latex:
Draw the following functions on different Cartesian planes:
\(y=x^2+4x+1\)
en.html:
Draw the following functions on different Cartesian planes:
\(y=x^2+4x+1\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{align}
\text{Shape: } a>0 &\text{ Concave upward} \\
y\text{-int: } (x=0)&\rightarrow (0;1) \\
x\text{-int: } (y=0)&\rightarrow 0=x^2+4x+1 \\
a=1\ b&=4\ c=1 \\
x&=\frac{-b\pm{\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}}{2a} \\
&=\frac{-4\pm{\sqrt{4^2-4(1)(1)}}}{2(1)} \\
x&=\frac{-4\pm{\sqrt{12}}}{2} \\
\therefore x\approx-0.27 &\text{ or } x\approx-3.73 \\
(-0.27;0) &\quad (-3.73;0) \\
\text{Symm. axis: } x&=\frac{-b}{2a} \\
x&=\frac{-4}{2(1)} \\
x&=-2 \\
\text{TP: } y&=(-2)^2+4(-2)+1 \\
y&=-3 \\
TP&(-2;-3)
\end{align}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{align}
\text{Shape: } a>0 &\text{ Concave upward} \\
y\text{-int: } (x=0)&\rightarrow (0;1) \\
x\text{-int: } (y=0)&\rightarrow 0=x^2+4x+1 \\
a=1\ b&=4\ c=1 \\
x&=\frac{-b\pm{\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}}{2a} \\
&=\frac{-4\pm{\sqrt{4^2-4(1)(1)}}}{2(1)} \\
x&=\frac{-4\pm{\sqrt{12}}}{2} \\
\therefore x\approx-0.27 &\text{ or } x\approx-3.73 \\
(-0.27;0) &\quad (-3.73;0) \\
\text{Symm. axis: } x&=\frac{-b}{2a} \\
x&=\frac{-4}{2(1)} \\
x&=-2 \\
\text{TP: } y&=(-2)^2+4(-2)+1 \\
y&=-3 \\
TP&(-2;-3)
\end{align}
$$

en.latex: Draw the functions on the same Cartesian plane
en.html: Draw the functions on the same Cartesian plane

en.latex:
$$
\begin{array} {ll}
p(x)=x^2-2 x\ & \ q(x)=4-x^2 \\
\therefore y=x^2-2 x \ & \therefore y=-x^2+4 \\
\text{Shape: } a>0 \text{ Concave upwards} \ & \text{Shape: } a<0 \text{ Concave downwards} \\
y \text{-intercept: } x=0 &y \text{-intercept: } x=0 \\
\therefore (0;0) & \therefore (0;4) \\
x \text{-intercept: } y=0 & x\text{-intercept: } y=0 \\
0=x^2-2 x & 0=4-x^2 \\
0=x(x-2) & 0=(2-x)(2+x) \\
x=0 \text{ or } x=2 & x=2\text{ or } x=-2 \\
(0;0) \ (2;0) &(2;0) \ (-2;0) \\
\text{Symmetry axis: }x=\frac{0+2}{2} & \text{Symmetric axis: }x=\frac{2-2}{2} \\
x=1 &x=0 \\
\text{TP: } y=(1)^2-2(1) & \text{TP: } y=4-(0)^2 \\
y=-1 & y=4 \\
\therefore (1;-1) & \therefore (0;4)
\end{array}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{array} {ll}
p(x)=x^2-2 x\ & \ q(x)=4-x^2 \\
\therefore y=x^2-2 x \ & \therefore y=-x^2+4 \\
\text{Shape: } a>0 \text{ Concave upwards} \ & \text{Shape: } a<0 \text{ Concave downwards} \\
y \text{-intercept: } x=0 &y \text{-intercept: } x=0 \\
\therefore (0;0) & \therefore (0;4) \\
x \text{-intercept: } y=0 & x\text{-intercept: } y=0 \\
0=x^2-2 x & 0=4-x^2 \\
0=x(x-2) & 0=(2-x)(2+x) \\
x=0 \text{ or } x=2 & x=2\text{ or } x=-2 \\
(0;0) \ (2;0) &(2;0) \ (-2;0) \\
\text{Symmetry axis: }x=\frac{0+2}{2} & \text{Symmetric axis: }x=\frac{2-2}{2} \\
x=1 &x=0 \\
\text{TP: } y=(1)^2-2(1) & \text{TP: } y=4-(0)^2 \\
y=-1 & y=4 \\
\therefore (1;-1) & \therefore (0;4)
\end{array}
$$

en.latex: Determine the equation of \(g(x)\) if \(g(x)\) the reflection of \(f(x)\) in the line \(y=x\)
en.html: Determine the equation of \(g(x)\) if \(g(x)\) the reflection of \(f(x)\) in the line \(y=x\)

en.latex:
$$
\begin{align}
g(x)&\rightarrow \text{The inverse of } f(x) \\
\therefore g: x&=3^y \\
\therefore y&=log_3(x) \\
\therefore g(x)&=log_3(x)
\end{align}
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{align}
g(x)&\rightarrow \text{The inverse of } f(x) \\
\therefore g: x&=3^y \\
\therefore y&=log_3(x) \\
\therefore g(x)&=log_3(x)
\end{align}
$$
